abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Emergency Drought
            Recovery Project for Ethiopia were as follows: outcomes were
            moderately satisfactory, risk to development outcome was
            moderate, Bank performance was moderately satisfactory, and
            borrower performance was moderately satisfactory. Some
            lessons learned included: clearly identifying which specific
            programs will be supported with counterpart equivalent of
            balance of payment support, agreeing on expenditure, output
            and outcome targets and monitoring their progress is
            important if such quick disbursing components are expected
            to contribute to achievements of specific Project
            Development Objectives (PDOs). An emergency response
            intervention may not be best suited to use innovative
            approaches for implementation. Stronger management oversight
            in ensuring that persistent and significant weaknesses in
            implementation are actually reflected in the ratings of
            Implementation Status and Results (ISRs) is essential for
            ISRs to actually serve as a meaningful management tool.
